TextView.android:text: Tags are one of the two ways to organize your verses in Scripture Now. A tag represents a keyword or topic that is closely associated with a verse, and is used to group together arbitrary groups of verses. Tags can be added to verses from several places within Scripture Now: by hashtags on the Input Verse Card, individually from the Edit Verse Screen, and to groups of verses from one of the Verse Lists.

When entering the text for a verse on the Input Verse card on the dashboard, any hashtags in the text will be removed and added as a tag. For example, #Jesus will add the tag "Jesus" to that verse, and the text "#Jesus" will be removed (so don't make the hashtag part of a sentence). Only the first word after a hashtag will become that tag, but you can wrap a phrase in quotations to add a phrase by hashtags, such as #"Jesus Christ". Hashtags added to the text in the Edit screen will behave in the exact same way.

From the Edit screen, you can add, remove, or edit tags on that single verse. By clicking on one of the chips, you are given the option to edit the name of that tag, which will affect all verses with that same tag. By long-clicking the tag chip, you are given the option to remove a verse, either just from the currently viewed verse, or from the entire database, removing it from all verses assocaited with the tag. You can also click the "Add New Tag" chip to add a new tag; suggestions will be shown as you type of current tags that match, so that you can be sure that you are adding the tag that you think you are. You may also add a tag that is not suggested, which will create a new tag.

From one of the verse lists, you can click a verse's icon to begin multiselecting verses. One of the batch actions is to add a tag to all selected verses, which will open a dialog which functions exactly the same as the single-verse dialog on the Edit screen.
